meanings.sent1: My estimation is that there are about ten cookies left in the jar.
meanings.sent2: Her estimation of the distance to the park was quite accurate.
meanings.sent3: In a game of 'guess the number,' my estimation skills are unmatched!
meanings.sent4: His estimation of the situation was like trying to hit a moving target.
meanings.sent5: The detective's estimation of the suspect's height helped solve the case.
meanings.sent6: After a quick estimation, I decided to buy three packs of gum.
meanings.sent7: The estimation of the cost for the project was way off.
meanings.sent8: We relied on her estimation to plan the picnic.
meanings.sent9: The estimation of the weight of the pumpkin was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent10: The estimation of the time it would take to finish the race was way off.

meanings.definition: The act of forming an opinion or judgment.
meanings.sent1: His estimation of the movie was that it would be boring.
meanings.sent2: The estimation of her character was based on first impressions.
meanings.sent3: I made an estimation that the new restaurant would be delicious.
meanings.sent4: The estimation of the weather forecast was completely wrong.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's estimation of the student's abilities was spot on.
